title: Amazon Hand Sanitizer
body: There is a Review on here that say's the top is hard to open & It broke for them But it is easy to open there is no trouble with this at all.I got the product on Saturday April 8th 2023 &Took out a bottle to see if it was hard to open but it was not hard buy very easy to open You should not have any issue with this product

title: love
body: so these are great and I love them but they do leave a slight taste on hands that you might notice if you eat fries or something with your hands right after using, the scent is very light but the aloe is definately more moisturing than the regular variety.

title: Best value anywhere and good quality!
body: Do the math per ounce, you will not beat Amazon, especially when they have deals for spending $50 or more.I previous bought the "Name brand" hand sanitizier and it was much more watery than I remember... Amazon's brand is ACTUALLY a bit more like the "gel" you remember from childhood! It is gel-like in your hand but it will obviously slide off if you wait a couple seconds then tilt your hand.The smell is exactly like the other aloe hand sanitizer brands.Price: $18.87 (-20% for spending over $50) so it was 15% $2.51 per bottle.If you include 5% off from the Amazon credit card, it is $14.15 and $2.35 per bottle.It is 12 oz, it takes 3 of them to make one of the name brand "big" bottles which are 36oz. 3 of the smaller Amazon sanitizers would be $7.05.Good luck finding a name brand 36oz bottle of hand sanitizer for $7.05.Amazon wins again.

title: Cheaper than the original

title: Short expiration date
body: Delivered Jan 10, 2023. Expiration date Jan 2023. Now I know alcohol will not expire but it explains the ‚Äútoo good to be true‚Äù price. However the sanitizer seems to have plenty of alcohol scented freshness and I‚Äôm sure it will help keep germs at bay this winter.

body: Yay, no tequila smell. Ok it smells like light alcohol but not strong. Yes it does burn cuts you didn't know about. It is more gentle on my skin than straight sanitizer with no aloe. It's not runny. Good value. Will buy again.

title: Great sanitizer; great value
body: It definitely pays to buy in bulk. These are large 34-oz containers in a package of 4 that is a little more than a gallon in total. I will use them to refill my 12-oz containers. Should last at least a year in my home if not longer. The scent is minimal and pleasant. I like the aloe; not sure if it really helps with moisturizing but the color is nice. Importantly, there is no sticky residue as with some inexpensive sanitizers. There is 62% ethyl alcohol; the CDC recommends sanitizers that are 60% or higher in alcohol concentration, so this should do the trick. I see no downsides to this product.

title: Definitely the best for several reasons!
body: I rarely do the reviews, however this product is worth taking a minute to share how happy I am with this product. As a Mom of a child with a complex medical condition, I have to use lot's of hand sanitizer. This is by far the best value for your money, and the easiest on my hands than any I've ever used. Fast delivery also and great customer service, as I was sent the wrong kind and it was replaced immediately with no return required. I highly recommend.

They do have a scent, but it‚Äôs not as strong as some other brands. The value is awesome. I highly recommend these!

title: Exceeded my expectations!
body: In these times it is hard to find decent hand sanitizer that doesn't cost a ton! I decided to give this a try and I'm pleasantly surprised. The aloe vera one smells great and leaves my hands soft! It is a little runnier than I'm used to but for I'm ok with that. Nothing worse than hand sanitizer that smells horrid and is super sticky - which this is neither of that! Definitely give it a try.

title: Smells great
body: Two years until expiration date. And smells great. Very good price.

title: Beware, people with fragrance sensitivity!
body: I am unclear on how anyone who posted reviews here thought there was no smell. Perhaps Amazon has changed the formula recently? The residual and distinct fragrance smell is very persistent, though admittedly not going to be vivid for people who can tolerate/wear cologne or use Axe body wash and such. I cannot handle these synthetic fragrances. This one is strong enough to almost cover the alcohol smell. I immediately washed my hands 3 times with soap and rinsed like 6 times and could still faintly smell this scent residue Just couldn't get it off. I had to eat finger foods right after and it was pretty disturbing to not be able to get the musky smell off. If I wanted overtly scented sanitizer I wouldn't buy something called "basic." I avoid the flashy colorful hand sanitizers that typically have distinct fragrance for the reason of my sensitivity. Never had a problem with the plain original Purell in the past or even the one from the Dollar Tree. Leaving on a trip this week and will have to stop at store for some, since I of course can't use this. I feel the name basic misrepresents this product. If you have even mild MCS or fragrance allergy don't choose this one.

title: Gentle
body: This hand sanitizer is gentle on my hands and the scent is fresh and pleasant.

title: CHEAP, in stock, and SMELLS good. What more do you want?
body: The pandemic brought to light the fact that a lot of hand sanitizers STINK. I'm a guy without a very picky nose, but holy moly some of them stink. I got a tip that these smell good, and it's true. Not perfumy, but not stinky. It's also not super runny. it's basically the old fashion germX I remember from childhood but without the hefty price.

title: I thought this smelled awful!
body: It could be just me, because some people's sense of smell is stronger than others (mine is), but this product smelled like soy sauce! Or something like that. Gross. And no, I was not eating anything that had soy sauce in it nor was I anywhere near soy sauce when I tried out this hand sanitizer for the first time! So, since I couldn't stand the smell and can't use this, had to get refund for this sanitizer.But otherwise, it didn't seem to dry out my hands (although it's difficult to assess this aspect of it since I only applied it maybe two times?), and consistency didn't feel sticky or too thick, which were the pros!If they change only the scent to a lemon scent (NOT orange!) I would buy this product in a heartbeat.

title: Amazon Basic Care Aloe Hand Sanitizer Good Basic Sanitizer

title: Yup, it's hand sanitizer.
body: The cost per ounce is one of the best deals around. I ordered a 4 pack of the 34oz bottles. Amazon notes that it's comparable to Germ-X. I found that the smell and consistency was indeed very similar when compared to a fresh bottle of Germ-X I had on hand. It wasn't sticky and dried without residue. No need to spend more money on the big brand stuff.
